channel.title: USB 3.0 10x faster then 2.0 (the Current one)
channel.description: I was just wondering if anyone here has heard of the USB 3.0 that is supposed to come out some time this year. Its going to have transfer speeds of 4.8Gb/s 10x faster then USB 2.0. Sounds pretty impressive to me....

item.title: USB 3.0 10x faster then 2.0 (the Current one)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:13, topic:272357”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=359335.msg2742884#msg2742884 date=1239471379]

Why not? USB power isn’t constant, there are different voltages it can provide and the device requests what it wants.

I’ve made a home-made usb fan and it seems to use a lot of electricity because Windows tells me the USB Device has malfunctioned.
Mopman, how much power can a device drain through USB, I’d expect its 12V…
In addition 2gb/s will be expected with most devices however I bet USB Memory Sticks will be dog slow like USB2.0 (8mb/s read speed…Phff)

[/quote]

Your psu only supplies 12v to the mobo, so it would be pretty hard to get 12v to the usb.[/quote]

That is not how electricity works. Think about it this way, your car delivers 12V to the fusebox, which delivers 12V to the headlights, the radio, the starter, the computer and everything else, a constant 12V. The only thing that decreases with the increase of items hooked into the same power source is the current, or amps.

Read full topic

item.title: USB 3.0 10x faster then 2.0 (the Current one)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

What the fuck was I smoking when I said voltage was current? Yknow what just ignore anything by me posted in this thread, I was crack smoking that day.

Mopman, how much power can a device drain through USB, I’d expect its 12V…
In addition 2gb/s will be expected with most devices however I bet USB Memory Sticks will be dog slow like USB2.0 (8mb/s read speed…Phff)

[/quote]

Your psu only supplies 12v to the mobo, so it would be pretty hard to get 12v to the usb.[/quote]

item.title: USB 3.0 10x faster then 2.0 (the Current one)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

voltage is not power, its current

your homemade usb fan should not be drawing more than 100mA without requesting it. it probably is, which is why windows is bitching (devices should always start in 100mA mode and then request more before drawing it)

i was wrong that usb can provide 12v, it is like mopar said only 5, the power mode requests are just requests to draw more amps so the hub can manage current between multiple devices

you can get faster usb2 sticks btw, the limiting factor on the cheap ones is not usb but the storage used (flash memory sucks ass)

Read full topic

[/quote]

Why not? USB power isn’t constant, there are different voltages it can provide and the device requests what it wants.[/quote]

item.title: USB 3.0 10x faster then 2.0 (the Current one)
item.dc:creator: @Bloodcompany Bloodcompany
item.description:
@Bloodcompany wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

USB

USB (abbreviation of Universal Serial Bus) is an industry standard that establishes specifications for cables, connectors and protocols for connection, communication and power supply between personal computers and their peripheral devices. Released in 1996, the USB standard is currently maintained by the USB Implementers Forum (USB IF). There have been three generations of USB specifications: USB 1.x, USB 2.0, USB 3.x. USB was designed to standardize the connection of peripherals like keybo...

USB 3.0 receptacles are compatible with USB 2.0 device plugs for the respective physical form factors. However, only USB 3.0 Standard-B receptacles can accept USB 3.0 Standard-B device plugs.

I guess so ^^

Read full topic
